meanings.sent1: She tends to misstate facts when she is nervous.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to misstate information in a report.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he would misstate the recipe and end up with a cake made of cheese.
meanings.sent4: Her exaggerated gestures misstate her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The witness's attempt to misstate the events was quickly exposed by the evidence.

meanings.sent1: He didn't mean to misstate the time of the meeting.
meanings.sent2: Politicians sometimes misstate their promises to gain votes.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's attempt to misstate the answer led to confusion among the students.
meanings.sent4: The map misstates the location of the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent5: The news article misstates the facts about the incident.
